intro: Kohautia euryantha, commonly known as the broad-leafed kohautia, is a rare flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided blades and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
